intro: Syngramma coriacea, commonly known as the rough syngramma, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves that are typically gray-green in color, and it produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a compact inflorescence. Syngramma coriacea is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
